name: FileLocation
comment: source_maps/source_maps-span.Location with values computed from an underling source_maps/source_maps-span.SourceFile.

sourceUrl.name: sourceUrl
sourceUrl.comment: Url of the source containing this span.

line.name: line
line.comment: The 0-based line in the source of this location.

column.name: column
column.comment: The 0-based column in the source of this location.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

sourceUrl.name: sourceUrl
sourceUrl.comment: Url of the source containing this span.

line.name: line
line.comment: The 0-based line in the source of this location.

column.name: column
column.comment: The 0-based column in the source of this location.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of source_maps/source_maps-span.FileLocation.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

compareTo.name: compareTo
compareTo.comment: Compares two locations. If the locations are not in the same source, this method generates an error.
